title: Core
content: Core The Sutil core engine. Definition for type SutilElement and functions that instantiate Browser DOM from SutilElement. Core.PipelineFn PipelineFn Core.SutilEffect SutilEffect Core.SutilElement SutilElement Core.SutilGroup SutilGroup Core.log log Core.sideEffect sideEffect

title: SutilEffect
content:
SutilEffect A SutilEffect is the result of evaluating a SutilElement, and can be one of the following:
SideEffect
This usually means the SutilElement was an attribute, and its evaluation resulted in a DOM call such as setAttribute, or classlist.add, etc
DomNode of Node
The SutilElement created a DOM Node. This is usually a Text or an HTMLElement
Group of SutilGroup
A SutilGroup has been created
SutilEffect.Dispose Dispose SutilEffect.Register Register SutilEffect.AsDomNode AsDomNode SutilEffect.RegisterDisposable RegisterDisposable SutilEffect.RegisterDisposable RegisterDisposable SutilEffect.RegisterUnsubscribe RegisterUnsubscribe SutilEffect.RegisterUnsubscribe RegisterUnsubscribe SutilEffect.SideEffect SideEffect SutilEffect.DomNode DomNode SutilEffect.Group Group

title: SutilElement
content:
SutilElement Sutil's element type. This is an abstraction of DOM elements, attributes, events, etc. The type itself is a function that maps BuildContext to a SutilEffect, wrapped in a private record to isolate users from implementation details as much as possible: 
 type SutilElement = private { Builder: BuildContext -> SutilEffect }
type SutilElement = private { Builder: (obj -> obj) }
SutilElement.Builder: obj -> obj
Examples of SutilElements:
  • Html.div
  • Attr.className
  • Ev.onClick
  • Core.disposeOnUnmount
  • Core.host
SutilElement.Define Define SutilElement.Define Define SutilElement.Define Define SutilElement.Define Define

title: CoreElements
content: CoreElements The core SutilElements required for building DOM, setting attributes, parsing HTML, managing resources etc. CoreElements.EventModifier EventModifier CoreElements.InputEvent InputEvent CoreElements.disposeOnUnmount disposeOnUnmount CoreElements.unsubscribeOnUnmount unsubscribeOnUnmount CoreElements.exclusive exclusive CoreElements.hookContext hookContext CoreElements.hookParent hookParent CoreElements.hookElement hookElement CoreElements.host host CoreElements.toggleClass toggleClass CoreElements.addClass addClass CoreElements.removeClass removeClass CoreElements.elns elns CoreElements.el el CoreElements.keyedEl keyedEl CoreElements.inject inject CoreElements.setProperty setProperty CoreElements.setValue setValue CoreElements.nothing nothing CoreElements.html html CoreElements.postProcess postProcess CoreElements.postProcessElements postProcessElements CoreElements.listenToResize listenToResize CoreElements.subscribe subscribe CoreElements.autofocus autofocus CoreElements.id' id' CoreElements.type' type' CoreElements.for' for' CoreElements.class' class' CoreElements.unclass unclass CoreElements.unclass' unclass' CoreElements.style style CoreElements.styleAppend styleAppend CoreElements.on on CoreElements.onCustomEvent onCustomEvent CoreElements.onKeyboard onKeyboard CoreElements.onMouse onMouse CoreElements.onInput onInput CoreElements.onClick onClick CoreElements.onElementReady onElementReady CoreElements.onMount onMount CoreElements.onUnmount onUnmount CoreElements.onShow onShow CoreElements.onHide onHide CoreElements.onKeyDown onKeyDown CoreElements.onMouseMove onMouseMove CoreElements.subscribeOnMount subscribeOnMount CoreElements.fragment fragment

title: CoreElements.disposeOnUnmount
content: CoreElements.disposeOnUnmount disposeOnUnmount Dispose all given items when the parent SutilElement is unmounted. Each item should implement System.IDisposable. See also: Core.unsubscribeOnUnmount

title: CoreElements.unsubscribeOnUnmount
content:
CoreElements.unsubscribeOnUnmount 
unsubscribeOnUnmount 

 Call each function of type `(unit -> unit)` when the element is unmounted

content:
CoreElements.exclusive

 Provides a hook for the parent DOM Node

title: CoreElements.hookElement
content: CoreElements.hookElement hookElement Provides a hook for the parent HTMLElement. This can be used, for example, to mount a React component. See https://sutil.dev/#documentation-hosting-react This will throw an InvalidCastException if the parent node is not an HTMLElement

title: CoreElements.inject
content:
CoreElements.inject 
inject 

 Merge these `SutilElement`s with another `SutilElement`.

title: CoreElements.setProperty
content:
CoreElements.setProperty 
setProperty 

 Set a property on the parent DOM Node

title: CoreElements.nothing
content: CoreElements.nothing nothing An empty element. This could be considered the unit value for a SutilElement. It is very similar in effect fragment [], since neither will add any HTMLElements. The main difference is that nothing will make no changes at all to the DOM, while fragment will create an internal SutilGroup that is registered on the parent element as a property.

title: CoreElements.html
content:
CoreElements.html 
html 

 Raw html that will be parsed and added as a child of the parent element

title: CoreElements.fragment
content: CoreElements.fragment fragment A collection of SutilElements as a single SutilElement. This is useful when we have a collection of SutilElements that we don't want to wrap in their own containing DOM element. Compare with Core.nothing.

Html.div [ (* children *) ]

content:

title: EngineHelpers.Ev
content:
EngineHelpers.Ev Ev DOM event handlers. Strictly speaking, these are attributes, but it's useful for them to have their own namespace. For example 
 Html.button [
     Ev.onClick (fun _ -> console("click"))
 ]

title: PseudoCss
content:
PseudoCss 

 Experimental pseudo-CSS styles
 
PseudoCss.addClass 
addClass 
PseudoCss.useGlobal 
useGlobal

title: PseudoCss.addClass
content:
PseudoCss.addClass addClass A pseudo-style that will add the given class if the rule matches. This example would add the class framework-button to any button element. 
 let css = [
     rule "button" [
         PseudoCss.addClass "framework-button"
     ]
 ]

 let view() =
     Html.button [
         text "Styled as a framework button"
     ] |> withStyle css
val css: obj list
val view: unit -> 'a
This was an experiment that would let me build DOM and then use a Sutil scoped style sheet to lift various elements into an 3rd-party framework (such as Bulma). In hindsight, it's too magical, not comprehensively implemented with respect to rule matching, and better achieved in other ways (for example, create wrapper buttons for the framework).

title: PseudoCss.useGlobal
content:
PseudoCss.useGlobal useGlobal A pseudo-style that when the containing rule matches, uses the top-level Sutil scoped stylesheet. For example, this example shows use applying a style that's defined further up the DOM hierarchy 
 let rootStyle = [ rule "div" [ Css.color "red"] ]
 let middleStyle = [ rule "div" [ Css.color "green"]  ]
 let bottomStyle = [ rule "div" [ useGlobal ] ]

 let view () =
     Html.div [
         text "I'm red"
         Html.div [
             text "I'm green"

             Html.div [
                 text "I'm red"
             ] |> withStyle bottomStyle

             Html.div [
                 text "I'm green"
             ]
         ] |> withStyle middleStyle
     ] |> withStyle rootStyle
val rootStyle: obj list
val middleStyle: obj list
val bottomStyle: obj list
val view: unit -> 'a
In hindsight, it's too magical, confusing and better achieved in other ways (for example have named stylesheets: withStyle rootStyle)

Store.mapDistinct mapDistinct Helper function for commonly used form 
     store |> Store.map (fun s -> s.Thing) |> Observable.distinctUntilChanged
module Observable from Microsoft.FSharp.Control

content:
Store.zip 
zip 

 Merges two stores into a single tupled observable

content:
Store.getMap 
getMap

 This might be called foldMap

title: Store.write
content:
Store.write 
write 

 Calls the callback upon initialization and whenever the store is updated. This is the same as subscribe
 and ignoring the unsubscription callback

content:
Store.modify 
modify 
Modify the store by mapping its current value with a callback

title: Store.subscribe2
content:
Store.subscribe2 
subscribe2 

 Takes two observables and subscribes to both with a single callback,
 both values will be cached individually and
 on every notify they will be updated and emitted,
 every notification can come from any of the observables

title: Store.makeElmishSimple
content:
Store.makeElmishSimple 
makeElmishSimple 

 Creates a store and a dispatch method commonly used
 in elmish programs, this can be used to model more complex views that require better
 control flow and a predictable state.

title: Store.makeElmish
content: Store.makeElmish makeElmish Creates a store and a dispatch function as Store.makeElmishSimple the difference being that this version handles [Elmish commands](https://elmish.github.io/elmish/index.html#Commands) as well, generally used in more complex UIs given that with commands you can also handle asynchronous code like fetching resources from a server or calling any function that returns a promise or async

title: StoreOperators
content:
StoreOperators 

 Operators for store functions
  
StoreOperators.(|->) 
(|->) 
StoreOperators.(.>) 
(.>) 
StoreOperators.(<~) 
(<~)

(<~-)

StoreOperators.(<~=) 
(<~=)

title: StoreOperators.(|->)
content: StoreOperators.(|->) (|->) Alias for Store.getMap, takes a store and applies a mapping function then returns the value from the evaluated function This might be called foldMap

title: StoreOperators.(.>)
content: StoreOperators.(.>) (.>) Alias for Store.map, returns an observable that will resolve to the result of said callback

title: StoreOperators.(<~)
content: StoreOperators.(<~) (<~) Alias for Store.set, replaces the current value of the store

title: StoreOperators.(<~-)
content: StoreOperators.(<~-) (<~-) Alias for Store.set, replaces the current value of the store

title: StoreOperators.(-~>)
content: StoreOperators.(-~>) (-~>) Alias for Store.set, replaces the current value of the store

title: StoreOperators.(<~=)
content: StoreOperators.(<~=) (<~=) Alias for Store.modify. Modify the store by mapping its current value with a callback

title: StoreOperators.(=~>)
content: StoreOperators.(=~>) (=~>) Alias for Store.modify Modify the store by mapping its current value with a callback

title: Bind
content: Bind Bindings for observables and the Core. For example, use an IObservable<bool> to toggle an element's class attribute Bind.attr attr Bind.attr attr Bind.attr attr Bind.attr attr Bind.className className Bind.classNames classNames Bind.each each Bind.each each Bind.each each Bind.each each Bind.each each Bind.each each Bind.eachi eachi Bind.eachi eachi Bind.eachi eachi Bind.eachi eachi Bind.eachi eachi Bind.eachi eachi Bind.el el Bind.el el Bind.el el Bind.el2 el2 Bind.fragment fragment Bind.fragment2 fragment2 Bind.leftTop leftTop Bind.promise promise Bind.promise promise Bind.promises promises Bind.selected selected Bind.selected selected Bind.selected selected Bind.selected selected Bind.style style Bind.style style Bind.toggleClass toggleClass Bind.toggleClass toggleClass Bind.visibility visibility Bind.visibility visibility Bind.widthHeight widthHeight

title: Bind.attr
content:
Bind.attr 
attr 

 Two-way binding from value to attribute and from attribute to dispatch function

title: Bind.attr
content:
Bind.attr 
attr 

 One-way binding from attribute to dispatch function

title: Bind.attr
content:
Bind.attr 
attr 

 One-way binding from value to attribute. Note that passing store to this function will
 select the more specific `attr<'T>( string, IStore<'T>)` overload.
 If that looks to be a problem, we'll rename both of them to force a considered choice.

title: Bind.attr
content:
Bind.attr 
attr 

 Dual-binding for a given attribute. Changes to value are written to the attribute, while
 changes to the attribute are written back to the store. Note that an IStore is also
 an IObservable, for which a separate overload exists.

title: SutilHtmlEngine
content:
SutilHtmlEngine Functions for building DOM elements. Note that not all members are documented here, only a few specialized augmentations over the class Feliz.HtmlEngine In theory, every HTML element should be an inherited member of SutilHtmlEngine, in the form 
     // Create div with float value as a child text node
     member _.div (value: float)

     // Create div with float value as a child text node
     member _.div (value: int)

     // Create div with SutilElement value as a child element
     member _.div (value: SutilElement)

     // Create div with string value as child text node
     member _.div (value: string)

     // Create div with multiple child SutilElements.
     // Not all SutilElements are DOM elements; they may be attribute-setters, or event-listeners
     member _.div (children: seq<SutilElement>)
Multiple items
val float: value: 'T -> float (requires member op_Explicit)

--------------------
type float = System.Double

--------------------
type float<'Measure> = float
Multiple items
val int: value: 'T -> int (requires member op_Explicit)

--------------------
type int = int32

--------------------
type int<'Measure> = int
Multiple items
val string: value: 'T -> string

--------------------
type string = System.String
Multiple items
val seq: sequence: seq<'T> -> seq<'T>

--------------------
type seq<'T> = System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<'T>
SutilHtmlEngine.``.ctor`` ``.ctor`` SutilHtmlEngine.app app SutilHtmlEngine.body body SutilHtmlEngine.div div SutilHtmlEngine.div div SutilHtmlEngine.div div SutilHtmlEngine.divc divc SutilHtmlEngine.fragment fragment SutilHtmlEngine.h1 h1 SutilHtmlEngine.h1 h1 SutilHtmlEngine.h1 h1 SutilHtmlEngine.h2 h2 SutilHtmlEngine.h2 h2 SutilHtmlEngine.h2 h2 SutilHtmlEngine.h3 h3 SutilHtmlEngine.h3 h3 SutilHtmlEngine.h3 h3 SutilHtmlEngine.h4 h4 SutilHtmlEngine.h4 h4 SutilHtmlEngine.h4 h4 SutilHtmlEngine.h5 h5 SutilHtmlEngine.h5 h5 SutilHtmlEngine.h5 h5 SutilHtmlEngine.h6 h6 SutilHtmlEngine.h6 h6 SutilHtmlEngine.h6 h6 SutilHtmlEngine.parent parent SutilHtmlEngine.parse parse SutilHtmlEngine.span span SutilHtmlEngine.span span SutilHtmlEngine.span span SutilHtmlEngine.td td SutilHtmlEngine.td td SutilHtmlEngine.td td SutilHtmlEngine.text text SutilHtmlEngine.text text SutilHtmlEngine.text text
